title: Bleeding Gastric Ulcer
diagnosis_topic: Hemorrhage from a gastric ulcer requiring endoscopic and medical management
setup_script: A 50-year-old man presents to the ED with hematemesis and melena. He has a history of chronic NSAID use for back pain.

dynamic_flow.reply: BP 100/60 mmHg, HR 110 bpm, RR 20/min, Temp 37 C; patient appears pale.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident places two large-bore IVs and initiates fluid resuscitation
dynamic_flow.reply: Start crystalloid followed by blood transfusion targeting Hgb >7 g/dL.
CBC shows hemoglobin 8 g/dL, platelets 200 K/uL; coagulation profile normal; BUN elevated relative to creatinine.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident starts IV proton pump inhibitor infusion
dynamic_flow.reply: Pantoprazole bolus and infusion to stabilize clot and reduce rebleeding risk.
Aspirates bright red blood confirming active upper GI bleeding.
Emergent endoscopy performed; a 1 cm gastric ulcer with a visible vessel is injected with epinephrine and clipped.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If endoscopic therapy fails or ulcer rebleeds
dynamic_flow.reply: Consider repeat endoscopy, arterial embolization or surgical oversewing and vagotomy with pyloroplasty.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident tests for H. pylori
dynamic_flow.reply: Urea breath test or biopsy; start eradication therapy if positive.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident discontinues NSAIDs and initiates PPI maintenance
dynamic_flow.reply: Educate patient about alternative analgesics and the need for long-term acid suppression.
Increased risk of continued bleeding, hemodynamic instability and mortality.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident evaluates for gastric outlet obstruction or malignancy
dynamic_flow.reply: Biopsy edges of ulcer to rule out malignancy; consider imaging or repeat endoscopy if symptoms persist.
Adherence to H. pylori therapy, avoidance of ulcerogenic medications and follow-up endoscopy to confirm healing.

critical_decision_points: Resuscitation and stabilization of a patient with bleeding gastric ulcer
Use of IV proton pump inhibitors and early endoscopic hemostasis
Recognition of indications for repeat endoscopy, embolization or surgery
Testing for H. pylori and cessation of NSAIDs
Follow-up endoscopy to ensure ulcer healing and rule out malignancy
